intro: Verbascum ovalifolium, commonly known as the oval-leaved mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Verbascum ovalifolium is a perennial plant that is both ornamental and has historical uses in traditional medicine.
